author: Staff Reporter
text:
Owners of marriage hall, printing press and lodges were asked not to violate the model code of conduct as it would lead to imprisonment and fine.

Addressing them at the collectorate on Wednesday, District Election Officer and Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy said that printing press owners should print the names of press, number of copies in the pamphlets printed for election purpose.

Also, no pamphlets should carry message that should hurt the religious sentiments or induce hated feeling among the people.

The Collector said that only if the political parties obtained permission from the election officials for conduct of meeting in marriage hall, the owners should permit them.

Imprisonment

If the owners found distribution of gifts or money in the marriage hall by the parties, they should inform the election officials, he added. If violations found, it invites up to six months imprisonment and also fine of Rs. 2,000.
title: Marriage hall owners, printers must follow norms: Collector
